feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 05 at 8:12AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...PERIODS OF FREEZING DRIZZLE FOR ANCHORAGE BOWL THROUGH THE MORNING... Periods of light freezing drizzle and mixed wintry precipitation are possible across the Anchorage Bowl this morning. Precipitation is expected to switch over to snow by the afternoon. Motorists are encouraged to slow down and allow extra time for travel.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 05 at 3:22AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Sea Levels Sunday Night Through Tuesday... Water levels continue to rise along the Arctic Coast from Utqiagvik west. The highest water levels are expected to occur Monday Night and Tuesday morning. Water may push up on top of the sea ice, and could cause ice to pile up on beaches from Utqiagvik west. No infrastructure flooding is expected at this time.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northern Arctic Coast; Western Arctic Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 05 at 3:15AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ..Elevated Water Levels and Ice Shove Possible Through Monday Afternoon... A series of storms moving north through the Bering Sea and into the Southern Chukchi Sea today will bring very strong south winds gusting as high as 75 mph today through and north of the Bering Strait and winds gusting to 60 mph along the outer coastal areas
entry.cap:areaDesc: Chukchi Sea Coast; Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast; Yukon Delta

entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued December 05 at 3:05AM AKST until December 05 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST TODAY... * WHAT...Strong winds occuring, with brief blizzard conditions expected. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 65 mph. * WHERE...Western Arctic Coast. * WHEN...Until noon AKST Monday.

entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST TODAY... * WHAT...Strong winds occuring, with near blizzard conditions in passes. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Northeastern Brooks Range.

entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST TODAY... * WHAT...Freezing rain, snow and blowing snow expected. Visibility one quarter mile o less at times. * WHERE...Chukchi Sea Coast.

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued December 04 at 1:39PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 AM AKST MONDAY... The Department of Environmental Conservation has issued an Air Quality Alert which is in effect from 5 PM this afternoon to 11 AM AKST Monday. North Pole has a Stage 2 alert.

entry.summary: ...The National Weather Service in Huntsville AL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Alabama... entry.title: Flood Warning issued December 05 at 8:02AM EST until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Lake and Volusia Counties. .The Saint Johns River at Astor remains in Minor Flood stage. It is forecast to continue a very slow fall while remaining within Minor Flood stage for the foreseeable future. Residents and interests along the river will continue to see Minor flood impacts.

entry.summary: ...The National Weather Service in North Platte NE has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Nebraska... North Platte River at Lewellen affecting Keith and Garden Counties. .An ice jam will cause water to infiltrate the lowlands along the river.
